message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.LG. 

The paper focuses on detecting user's stance towards different topics on social media, which involves natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning techniques to analyse user's posts and online interactions. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also examines various online features of users, including network interactions, user's preferences, and online network connections, which are related to social network analysis (cs.SOC) and information retrieval (cs.IR). The paper also uses machine learning techniques to model the stance detection problem, which falls under the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the paper presents an extensive analysis of the different set of features that can reveal stance, which could be related to data mining (cs.SI).
